g.title: leaf_9
g.text: I just got orb stood up in the pylon bootloader distribution.

g.title: leaf_18
g.text: This all goes into global space for now. Our more sophisticated loader will
handle namespace isolation. Meanwhile we're building a repl, so.

g.title: leaf_26
g.text: -- #todo make this properly black and white ts
I'll keep this around for a bit, it looks nice
local f, err = loadstring('return ' .. chunk, 'REPL') -- first we prefix return
f, err = loadstring(chunk, 'REPL') -- try again without return
-- Lua expects some more input; stow it away for next time

g.title: leaf_33
g.text: We buffer escape sequences, which terminate in an alphabetic value.

g.title: leaf_35
g.text: No special effort to detect "^[[" (as opposed to just "^[") is made, that is

g.title: leaf_47
g.text: local dash = a.stash() .. a.jump(_row, 80) .. str .. a.pop()
-- This front matter belongs in the escape handling code.

g.title: leaf_48
g.text: for i, _ in ipairs(keybuf) do keybuf[i] = nil end

g.title: leaf_49
g.text: -- Get names for as many values as possible
-- This switches screens and does a wipe,
print "an repl, plz reply uwu ðŸ‘€"
-- Crude hack to choose raw mode at runtime
-- Jump to bottom right and report position.

g.title: leaf_44
g.text: This is a stateful event loop, no way around it.

g.title: leaf_46
g.text: State is maintained in the following upvalues.
